metadata.title: CVE-2023-0767 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could construct a PKCS 12 cert bundle in such a way that couldallow for arbitrary memory writes via PKCS 12 Safe Bag attributes beingmishandled. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8,and Firefox ESR < 102.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.9
libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
nss package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.9').
